Wow, that is a relief to hear. My dad was on 20mg 3x a day before his thyroid was removed so I‚Äôve been feeling like my doctor gave me this dosage as a placebo or something lol. I‚Äôm 85 pounds right now and I‚Äôm waiting and praying for the weight to come back because i look and feel like a skeleton lmao. I really want to be back at a triple digit weight by the end of the year but I don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs a reachable goal because I‚Äôm still losing weight despite having an increased appetite. Right now I‚Äôm just hoping to get to 90 lbs.

Thank you so much for replying! I‚Äôm trying to learn more about other people‚Äôs experiences with Graves to navigate myself through this. (My dad has Graves but won‚Äôt really talk to me about it) I was put on 5mg methimazole daily and from what I‚Äôve heard that‚Äôs not even a helpful dose, but then why would my endocrinologist prescribe me that dose?? would you consider that a normal dosage? Did you have any side effects? The beta blocker I‚Äôm on helps with the pulse and tremors but also makes me fall asleep every time I take it (3x daily) so I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm going to do when quarantine is over and I have to go back to school and work.

Im a baby Grave‚Äôs over here and my resting heart rate ranges from 100-120 without beta blockers üòì. the fatigue is real!!! were you put on an anti thyroid medication? methimazole is not really working for me right now and I‚Äôm worried about a possible thyroid storm.

Congratulations!!!! I can‚Äôt wait for this to happen to me someday. I‚Äôm in my early 20s and spent so much of my early adult life living exactly like what you described it as. Currently in bed after taking my Tapezole after an all nighter. I hope you update post-op! Best wishes for a safe procedure and a speedy recovery! üíï
yep. when it rains it pours and it‚Äôs been pouring my whole life. can‚Äôt seem to catch a break either

I was self medicating to the point where I could take 3 bars at a time and be fully functional (whereas my sister or bf could take 1/3 or 1/4 of 1 bad and feel wonky/knock out). I think that‚Äôs when I realized holy shit I‚Äôve gone overboard with this. I had a strict plan to not get addicted but they were so easy to come by and I was rationalizing my usage (starting Wellbutrin sent me into panic mode). Right now I am down to half a bar a day, just to be safe. I feel like I can mentally go without taking them now but I know benzo withdrawals can be fatal so just being extra cautious.

Whoa oh my god I feel like this is so serendipitous !! I‚Äôm 22, a pianist and singer and last year I decided 2020 would be the year I would finally start a project and release it. Due to health issues, school, work, and now Covid I was never able to even try. I‚Äôm not sure if I‚Äôd be able to provide much music-wise but I‚Äôd be happy to hear what you‚Äôre working on and be there for support and encouragement! If you need some background vocals or piano riffs, I‚Äôd love to try to help!
Hi, 22F over here and a music nerd! I‚Äôm not sure what kind of music you‚Äôre making but this sounds like something fun to take on during quarantine!
Kilig was the word I got Gigil mixed up with LOL
Haha! There‚Äôs a specific word to describe this feeling in Tagalog, ‚Äúgigil‚Äù.

Hello, 22F and have been clinically diagnosed with MDD since I was 16. I made some changes to my mental health plan recently and so I am looking for someone that can support me when I feel like it‚Äôs too much. And I would do the same for you as well (:
I‚Äôm in love with this, it‚Äôs one of my favorite songs of all time. I‚Äôd love to play the piano along with your rendition, it‚Äôs beautiful!
Is buspar an SSRI? I‚Äôd like to ask my doctor about it

The biggest mistake I made was trying to get off Prozac too fast. I was like yeah I can go from 20 to 10 to 0 in the span on three weeks and it ultimately backfired on me. My doctor really helped me out by giving me a strict dosage plan that used really small increments (going from 20 mg one week to 15mg the next, 10mg after, then 5mg and even 2.5 mg (which I found really funny like was there even a point? Lol) but yeah it will take a while. Honestly I feel better without the Prozac already.

hi! im on wellbutrin and lexapro and have just recently stopped Prozac after 6 years. it did help for a while but like you said it kind of just stopped working. my doctor still wants me on an SSRI for anxiety so I just started that...not sure how it‚Äôs going yet but Wellbutrin‚Äôs helped me the most. I think you should talk to your doctor about weaning off Prozac, it was a very long process going from 20mg to 0. good luck!
Just DMd you
Hey, I‚Äôm awake and interested!!

Yes it‚Äôs been about a month, had a 1 pound increase at my halfway appt and then lost 3 pounds at my last one. And I had been eating so much more and was sure I had gained at least one pound....but turns out I was losing that whole time. My GP has suggested a high fat, high carb diet along with a little more sodium to help with this. Is there a way I can gain weight quickly so I won‚Äôt feel so weak all the time?i feel like a literal skeleton ):

Wow, that is a really big jump in terms of dosages. I think I‚Äôm deciding to stick with the Tapezole and possibly asking about increasing the dosage by a little bit. It‚Äôs good to know that this is one of those meds that take a while to make it known that they are working. I have an appointment with my endo in a month and I till don‚Äôt really know what to expect.

Yeah, I do not want to be on this med anywhere near before I‚Äôm trying to conceive. I think I‚Äôll go for the radioactive iodine treatment, it is what my dad did after his thyroid storm ands easily managed by taking his synthroid daily.

Hi, do you plan on having a total removal of your thyroid one day? Ideally I would stay on low dose Tapezole as long as I could but I want to be able to have children without complications due to the medication or the hyperthyroidism (I‚Äôve had a miscarriage before from being undiagnosed.)
Wow, that‚Äôs a pretty low dose, maybe I should be looking into lessening my dosage instead of increasing it? Thanks for answering by the way. Everyone has been so helpful here with my med questions.

That‚Äôs a relief to know, I was worried the medication it self was causing my hair to fall out in clumps. Hopefully it‚Äôs just taking it‚Äôs sweet time. I have an appointment scheduled in a few weeks with my endo and I‚Äôll ask about increasing the Tapezole dosage.

I‚Äôm so sorry to hear. I‚Äôm about 80 pounds myself and feeling so so low. I lost about 30 pounds in the span of 3 months. 
Have you ever stopped taking the medication because your thyroid levels went back to normal? Or is the radiation/thyroidectomy the only way out? I want to be able to conceive one day and not be on this medication. I had a previous miscarriage that was due to undiagnosed hyperthyroidism. My dad did the radioactive iodine treatment around 20 years ago and takes levothyroxine, or synthroid every day and I feel like I can manage hypo better than hyper if that makes sense.
I see. Do you feel as if the medication is helping you? In what ways? How do you tell if it is helping or not?
Yeah, maybe my endo just wanted to see if I had any adverse effects from the drug. if I were to double, would I feel the difference right away?

May I ask what dosage of the methimazole was you were on? I made a post a few minutes ago about my dosage and it‚Äôs efficacy and I‚Äôm really curious to know how much other people take. When you say it two weeks to start feeling effects can you elaborate on that? Did your hyperthyroidism symptoms just vanish? I guess I don‚Äôt know what to look for in terms of this mrs working for me. I haven‚Äôt really felt like I‚Äôm getting better and feel like I am actually getting worse. I‚Äôm 22F and just starting this hyperthyroid journey and I‚Äôm overwhelmed and could use a lot of guidance and advice from others.

If you‚Äôre still okay with that! If not it‚Äôs okay (:

I‚Äôm four years older than her but we are extremely close and consider each other best friends. People always mistake us for twins or think she‚Äôs the elder sister! We get this so much that we just give each other a Look whenever it happens haha. We took a course together in college and our classmates were flabbergasted at the fact that we chose to be in the class. They were like ‚Äúdon‚Äôt you guys get tired of each other??‚Äù and we were like ‚Äúnope. We‚Äôre pretty much together all the time.‚Äù I love her so much, she‚Äôs grown from someone I helped raise into her own person. When we were younger our relationship was more like ‚Äúbig sister taking care of little sister‚Äù but as we got older and started having honest conversations about our personal lives we started getting closer and closer. Now that she‚Äôs an adult it‚Äôs feeling less like ‚Äútaking care‚Äù of her and more so like guiding her. I even go to her for advice and comfort now. She‚Äôs the only other person in the world who understands exactly what I mean without having to explain anything.

I‚Äôve berated myself for so long because I have always given my whole self away in both platonic and romantic relationships. I give myself up completely for partners because I believe I am worthless and I have nothing good to give, so I attempt to make up for that by putting in my 100% all of the time and it hurts because I‚Äôve never received the kind of love I give. I tell myself it‚Äôs my fault for being too vulnerable, too trusting, too loyal, too selfless in my relationships because I don‚Äôt recognize my self-worth. But I‚Äôm not going to let that stop me from giving my all even though it‚Äôs never reciprocated. I won‚Äôt let the world harden my softness. I‚Äôll continue to be soft, and vulnerable and compassionate while working on my level of self-respect. I can still be who I am without letting people take advantage of me, I just need to learn how and to consider myself as a strong person worthy of respect. Thank you for posting this. I‚Äôve really been struggling with self-respect and how it affects my relationships. I hope I can learn to love myself more and to love others in a way that is healthy for me.

Ohh okay I totally feel you. When I was just starting on Wellbutrin it was giving me panic attacks. I tried to smoke them away as usual, but the weed only made me more anxious and so I stopped smoking for a little bit until I could adjust to the Wellbutrin. 
Even now after a few months on Wellbutrin, I make sure to only smoke indicas or eat indica edibles. Sativa + Wellbutrin results in paranoia for me every single time. Makes me kinda sad because I loved sativas but it feels good not being anxious all the time.
I have the link saved somewhere, let me get back to you.

Hey! Feel sick in what way? I smoke (or used to) daily while on bupropion. It helped bring back my appetite that the meds suppressed. Is it like a nauseous feeling or a physically sick feeling like congestion?
And then denying he ever called it a hoax

I‚Äôm really sorry about this. I can kind of relate to how you feel but it‚Äôs about a family member. My dad has RA and Graves and works as a nurse with COVID patients. He debated between not taking his medication so he wouldn‚Äôt be so immunocompromised and taking the medication because he would physically deteriorate. When my sister told me that I cried, it‚Äôs just not fair that he even has to think about sacrificing his quality of life. He decided to stay on his medication anyway but he is still working in the hospital. I wish he could just stay home but he knows he‚Äôs needed right now. I think you should stay on your meds and just try as much as possible to limit your exposure with other people, i know that must be hard because you mentioned taking public transit. Please take care of yourself, and best wishes to you.
god. Sometimes I gotta say ‚Äúbitch shit the fuck up‚Äù out loud cause I‚Äôm over myself lmao

This has been such a divisive topic in family conversation over the years...LOL. I‚Äôve always said Ranch 99!!

Hi!! I‚Äôm 22F and am starting this whole hyperthyroidism journey. My dad has Graves‚Äô disease as well as RA and had his thyroid removed too. I‚Äôve been feeling the hyperthyroid symptoms for a few years but around 6 months ago things started getting a lot worse (losing 20 pounds rapidly, a very noticeable tremor, waking up sweating) but I chalked it up to my antidepressants. I had an appt with my MD two weeks weeks ago and she told me it did not sound like my antidepressants were causing these symptoms at all but I was displaying classic signs of hyperthyroidism. She sent me to the labs for blood work and my readings came back abnormal (high t4, but normal TSH??) and she could not figure out why. She put me on on a beta blocker for now (propranolol) to control my heart rate. She knows my family history of autoimmune disorders and asked me to see my dads endocrinologist, as he might have better knowledge on how to treat me since he has been treating my dad. I saw the endo on Tuesday and he too could not explain the abnormal readings, but based on symptoms and family history deduced it is hyperthyroidism but he doesn‚Äôt know why. He sent me to the lab for more thyroid function tests (free T4, TSH ultra sensitive, TSI, and t3) and I am waiting to hear on them. He says he will most likely start me on Tapezole, but that it might not work long term and I may have to do the radioactive iodine treatment. For now we‚Äôre just waiting on the lab results. It‚Äôs been a wild two weeks. 
Please feel free to dm me! I‚Äôm sorry you‚Äôre experiencing this right now. We‚Äôre both young and the pandemic situation is making everything so much more stressful. I‚Äôm here for you girl!!
Album out tomorrow!!!
I can‚Äôt believe there are others out there!! Lol
Maladaptive daydreaming?
Thank you for the gem that is ‚ÄúThe Bell That Couldn‚Äôt Jingle‚Äù

I didn‚Äôt realize how much I ate out with my bf, we‚Äôd go out for meals around 3x a week but now we just eat home cooked food. Finding new restaurants or going to our usual places were pretty much the only time we would go out and do something. (At least it‚Äôs saving us money!) I miss going to school and actually seeing my classmates and professors. I miss just calling my friends and cousins and asking if they wanted to run errands together. Impromptu visits from family. Seeing my boyfriend‚Äôs family. I miss my extended family so much. This is the longest time we have gone without all seeing each other. We have a large family group chat and FaceTime, but it just isn‚Äôt the same. 

Most of all, I miss my preschool babies. I work in childcare/preschool and had the realization that I would never see a lot of my kids again, because they will be heading off to kindergarten by the time we might be coming back to work. I truly love my job and it brought so much joy to my life to be around these tiny people and teaching them how to navigate the world. The fact that I never really got to say goodbye to the older ones going to grade school breaks my heart. I hope they remember me.
